Question
========
What is a key risk if you ever commit sensitive data to a public repository?

Answerlist
----------
* Git automatically anonymizes sensitive fields
* Deleting the file removes it from the full history
* The file becomes private after 24 hours
* The data remains in history unless you start over with a new repo

Solution
========
Git keeps full history, so sensitive data can persist even if you delete the file later.

Answerlist
----------
* False
* False
* False
* True
